title: Jakel invests in data centre project worth RM1.2 bil
summary:
Jakel Group is partnering with PiDC Holding Bhd to build a 51MW data centre in Cyberjaya worth RM1.2 billion.

In a statement on Saturday, Jakel said it is taking up a 40% stake in the project, Pi Data Centre Sdn Bhd, while the remaining 60% is held by PiDC.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 1): Jakel Group is partnering with PiDC Holding Bhd to build a 51MW data centre in Cyberjaya worth RM1.2 billion.

In a statement on Saturday, Jakel said it is taking up a 40% stake in the project, Pi Data Centre Sdn Bhd, while the remaining 60% is held by PiDC.

The data centre will be a state-of-the-art Tier III Data Centre spanning a 7.3-acre site in Cyberjaya.

title: Hannah Yeoh welcomes MACC probe into Selangor demand responsive transit project
summary: Youth and Sports Minister Hannah Yeoh has welcomed the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) probe into the Selangor demand responsive transit (DRT) proof of concept.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 1): Youth and Sports Minister Hannah Yeoh has welcomed the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) probe into the Selangor demand responsive transit (DRT) proof of concept.

In a post on the X platform, Yeoh expressed her desire for the investigation to reveal the truth and provide vindication.

"Now that the probe has started, I want to see the truth and vindication come out of this investigation. Malaysia deserves nothing less," she said.<

title: Sarawak Pan Borneo Highway: Works Ministry seeks RM1b allocation to upgrade redline alignment
summary: The Works Ministry will request an allocation of around RM1 billion to maintain and upgrade the 'redline' alignment along the Sarawak Pan Borneo Highway (LPB) project, said its Minister Datuk Seri Alexander Nanta Linggi.
content:
KUCHING (June 1): The Works Ministry will request an allocation of around RM1 billion to maintain and upgrade the 'redline' alignment along the Sarawak Pan Borneo Highway (LPB) project, said its Minister Datuk Seri Alexander Nanta Linggi.

He said the redline refers to the existing original routes built before the construction of the LPB and needs to be upgraded to meet the standards of the mega project.

title: Jakel invests in Cyberjaya data centre project
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Jakel Group is venturing into the data centre business by partnering PiDC Holdings Bhd via a 40% investment in Pi Data Centre Sdn Bhd (PiDC).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Jakel Group is venturing into the data centre business by partnering PiDC Holdings Bhd via a 40% investment in Pi Data Centre Sdn Bhd (PiDC).

In a statement, the group said this strategic investment marks a pivotal milestone in Jakel Group's enterprising journey, enabling the company to rebalance its investment portfolio by incorporating digital infrastructure alongside its established interests in textile trading, wholesale, property development and leasin

title: The Week Ahead: EPF conference, Najib’s RM6.6 bil IPIC trial and whether the ECB will cut rates this week
summary: Whether the European Central Bank (ECB) will be the first major central bank to cut rates this week is likely to dominate global headlines as the guessing game continues on when rates will come down at the US Federal Reserve, which enters a two-week black-out period on June 1.
content:

title: Double cover: Opportunity knocks on Malaysia’s door + Improved 1Q earnings report, profit growth seen on track in 2H
summary: Amid the escalating US-China tech 'Cold War' and soaring demand for artificial intelligence (AI)-driven chips, Malaysia finds itself at a pivotal crossroads.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 1): Amid the escalating US-China tech 'Cold War' and soaring demand for artificial intelligence (AI)-driven chips, Malaysia finds itself at a pivotal crossroads.

As global chip firms adopt a "China Plus One" strategy to diversify their supply chain, Malaysia stands poised to capitalise on this strategic shift.

summary: It's been a banner year for the major US stock indices, but one economically sensitive corner of the market sticks out as a sore spot.
content:

title: Oil prices settle down ahead of Opec+ meeting
summary: Oil prices fell on Friday and posted a weekly loss as investors awaited an Opec+ meeting on Sunday that will determine the fate of the producer group's output cuts.
content:
Brent futures for July delivery were down 24 cents, or 0.3%, to US$81.62 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures fell 92 cents, or 1.2%, at US$76.99.

NEW YORK: Oil prices fell on Friday and posted a weekly loss as investors awaited an Opec+ meeting on Sunday that will determine the fate of the producer group's output cuts.

title: Year's best daily gain for Dow, indices up sharply for May
summary: The Dow and S&P 500 ended higher on Friday and the Dow registered its biggest daily percentage gain since November 2023 as month-end repositioning drove a late sharp rally, with all three major indices posting strong gains for May.
content:
The Dow rose 574.84 points, or 1.51%, to 38,686.32. The S&P 500 gained 42.03 points, or 0.80%, at 5,277.51 and the Nasdaq lost 2.06 points, or 0.01%, at 16,735.02.

NEW YORK: The Dow and S&P 500 ended higher on Friday and the Dow registered its biggest daily percentage gain since November 2023 as month-end repositioning drove a late sharp rally, with all three major indices posting strong gains for May.<

title: MACC to probe new leads on contract allegations involving minister's husband
summary:
The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) is conducting an extensive investigation into allegations surrounding contract awards involving a minister's husband.

An MACC source said this follows several new complaints received regarding the appointment of a minister's husband to provide proof of concept for a transport project by the Selangor Government
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 31): The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) is conducting an extensive investigation into allegations surrounding contract awards involving a minister's husband.

An MACC source said this follows several new complaints received regarding the appointment of a minister's husband to provide proof of concept for a transport project by the Selangor Government.

title: Putrajaya line MRT service restored at 9.48pm after communication system issues
summary:
The Putrajaya Line MRT service, which experienced disruptions due to communication system issues, has been restored as of 9.48pm on Friday night.

Rapid Rail Sdn Bhd (Rapid Rail), in a statement, informed that the Putrajaya Line MRT service had faced schedule delays starting from 7.22pm due to a signalling system disruption.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 31): The Putrajaya Line MRT service, which experienced disruptions due to communication system issues, has been restored as of 9.48pm on Friday night.

Rapid Rail Sdn Bhd (Rapid Rail), in a statement, informed that the Putrajaya Line MRT service had faced schedule delays starting from 7.22pm due to a signalling system disruption.

title: Construction industry must adopt digital technology, reduce reliance on foreign workers — Fadillah
summary:
The construction industry needs to adopt digital technology such as artificial intelligence (AI), to reduce reliance on low-skilled foreign workers.

Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof stated that this would not only empower local contractors but also help bridge the productivity gap, ensuring they remained competitive on the international stage.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 31): The construction industry needs to adopt digital technology such as artificial intelligence (AI), to reduce reliance on low-skilled foreign workers.

Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof stated that this would not only empower local contractors but also help bridge the productivity gap, ensuring they remained competitive on the international stage.

title: With robust E&E ecosystem, Penang anticipates more high-impact investment from China
summary: As the ‘Silicon Valley of the East’ with business friendly policies and a robust electric and electronic (E&E) ecosystem, Penang is ready to anticipate more high-impact investments from China in the years to come, said Chief Minister Chow Kon Yeow.
content:
GEORGE TOWN (May 31): As the ‘Silicon Valley of the East’ with business friendly policies and a robust electric and electronic (E&E) ecosystem, Penang is ready to anticipate more high-impact investments from China in the years to come, said Chief Minister Chow Kon Yeow.

He said China’s approved investment in Penang as of 2023 had amounted to an astonishing RM1,799.6 million, with the presence of more than 50 Chinese multinational corporations (MNCs) across the state.

title: Federal govt supports Labuan-Sabah bridge proposal, calls for updated technical study
summary:
The federal government on Friday expressed support for the long-overdue construction of a bridge linking Labuan island to mainland Sabah, pending comprehensive reports on its implications.

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim, however, emphasised the need to update the existing technical study to reflect current conditions.
content:
LABUAN (May 31): The federal government on Friday expressed support for the long-overdue construction of a bridge linking Labuan island to mainland Sabah, pending comprehensive reports on its implications.

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim, however, emphasised the need to update the existing technical study to reflect current conditions.

title: Anwar urges caution on calls for Malaysia’s withdrawal from US-led maritime exercise
summary:
Malaysia must adopt a rational approach in responding to calls from non-governmental organisations (NGOs) to withdraw from a US-led maritime military exercise that includes the participation of the Israeli army.

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim emphasised the need for thorough consideration of the matter and its potential implications.
content:
LABUAN (May 31): Malaysia must adopt a rational approach in responding to calls from non-governmental organisations (NGOs) to withdraw from a US-led maritime military exercise that includes the participation of the Israeli army.

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim emphasised the need for thorough consideration of the matter and its potential implications.

content:
